A fresh verification link has been sent: A fresh verification link has been sent to your email address.
Before proceeding, please check your ema: Before proceeding, please check your email for a verification link.
Contrairement à beaucoup de langues, il: Unlike many languages, there is no gender in MaCuSi. Nouns are therefore neither masculine nor feminine.
Elle se construit de la manière suivante: It is constructed as follows: the subject is placed at the beginning of the sentence followed by the verb and then come the various complements.
Elle se construit de la même manière que: It is built in the same way as the declarative sentence but with the addition of the word [Wa] where you want in the sentence.

If you did not create an account, no fur: If you did not create an account, no further action is required.

Il n’y a pas de pluriel. Le sens de la p: There is no plural. The meaning of the sentence is determined by context. In some rare cases, to specify a plural, the noun can be used with the addition of the word [Si].
They are not very used in MaCuSi.
Invalid JSON was returned from the route: Invalid JSON was returned from the route.
J'aurais mangé un fruit: I would have eaten a fruit
Je mangerai un fruit demain: I will eat a fruit tomorrow
Je mangerais un fruit si tu en as acheté: I would eat a fruit if you bought some
L'article n'est pas nécessaire en MaCuSi: The article is not necessary in MaCuSi.
La virgule [,] pour séparer les éléments: The comma [,] to separate similar elements, an explanation...;
Le MaCuSi n’utilise pas le point d’inter: MaCuSi does not use the question mark, hyphen, brackets, asterisk, or paragraph indentation.
Le MaCuSi utilise les signes de ponctuat: MaCuSi uses the following Western punctuation marks:
Le nom propre s’écrit comme dans sa lang: Proper nouns are written as in their original language.
Le point [.] pour terminer une phrase ou: The period [.] to end a sentence or write an abbreviated word;
Le point d’exclamation [!] pour exprimer: The exclamation point [!] to express an exclamation or imperative;
Le point-virgule [;] pour séparer des pr: The semicolon [;] to separate clauses of the same type;
Le verbe au conditionnel est toujours su: The conditional tense verb is always followed by the term [Wi] or a specification of the time during which the action takes place.
Le verbe au conditionnel passé est toujo: The past conditional tense verb is always followed by the terms [We] and [Wi].
Le verbe au futur est toujours suivi du: The future tense verb is always followed by the term [ZeWe] or a specification of the time during which the action takes place.
Le verbe au passé est toujours suivi du: The past tense verb is always followed by the term [We] or a specification of the time during which the action takes place.
The verb does not match the subject. It will always remain in the infinitive.
Le verbe se présente toujours sous sa fo: The verb always appears in its infinitive form.
Les compléments doivent toujours se trou: Complements must always be at the end of the sentence. Their order, however, is not defined.
Les deux points [:] pour présenter une c: Colon [:] to present a quote, analysis, or enumeration;
Les guillemets [« »] [''] pour encadrer: Quotation marks [« »] [''] to enclose a quote, speech...;
Les mots en MaCuSi ne comportent pas d’a: Words in MaCuSi do not have accents, umlauts, cedillas, hyphens, ligatures, apostrophes, liaisons, or elisions. The letters H, K, Q, Y are used only for proper nouns.
Les parenthèses [()] pour ajouter une in: Parentheses [()] to add an accessory indication.
Les phrases exclamatives ou impératives: Exclamatory or imperative sentences are constructed in the same way as the declarative sentence with the addition of the exclamation point at the end of the sentence.
Moi Manger Fruit Condition Toi Acheter P: Me Eat Fruit Condition You Buy Past Fruit
Name: Name
Nous Partir Dans 3 Jours Dans Désert: Us Leave In 3 Day In Desert
Nous Partir Dans Désert Dans 3 Jours: Us Leave In Desert In 3 Day
Nous partirons dans le désert dans trois: We will leave for the desert in three days
Nous partirons dans trois jours dans le: We will leave in three days in the desert
Pas d’accord pour les adjectifs. Il se p: No agreement for adjectives. They always come after the noun.
Please click the button below to verify: Please click the button below to verify your email address.
Please confirm your password before cont: Please confirm your password before continuing.
Se construit de la même manière que la p: Is constructed in the same way as the declarative sentence but with the addition of the word [Ze] after the verb.
The response is not a streamed response.
The response is not a view.
This password reset link will expire in: This password reset link will expire in :count minutes.
You are receiving this email because we: You are receiving this email because we received a password reset request for your account.
La base de MaCuSi se tient dans une cour: The basis of MaCuSi is a short list of syllables translating the most basic concepts possible in order to make them modular.
Liste des mots formant la base de MaCuSi: List of words forming the basis of MaCuSi
